inn1.comm: starts on the legs first up, length ball, straightening on leg. Strikes Amla in the pad and the batsmen take a leg bye
length again, straightening on middle. De Kock gets a little stride in and plays a forward defence
edge! But there's only one slip and he's too wide to stop that. Might not have carried either. De Kock drives a full ball away from his body and gets it to the right of Mahela for four
more intent in that shot. Malinga straightens this on de Kock's pads, and the batsman whips this casually through midwicket for a boundary
full and angled in, de Kock pushes it to cover
another edge, and another boundary. This was length outside the stumps, de Kock pushes at it and connects with the outside part of the bat, and it flies well past slip and down to the fence
floated up on off stump, Amla pushes it to long on for one
floated in outside off stump, de Kock drives straight to short cover
whoah, the wind seems to have got hold of this one. Floated up, but swinging away with the wind. De Kock gets it as far as point
floated up on off stump, pushed to short cover again
full, just outside off stump, de Kock defends
a bit shorter, a little wider and spinning away. De Kock cuts in front of point, but doesn't beat the ring
length outside the stumps, Amla stands tall and punches it straight to cover
not all that short, but it's well wide and Amla won't fluff around in this kind of form. He's cut that beautifully behind square, all along the ground for a boundary
full and straight, pushed to mid off
slightly wider again from Malinga, Amla gets low and drive-cuts it past point, but there's a man on the fence there now
full on off stump, turned to short midwicket
full and outside off, de Kock opens the face in a sort of square-drive and makes third man do some work
woah, the wind is really taking effect here. This one drifts way down the legside. That's a wide
straighter this time, not a lot of turn, Amla turns it to leg where it's fielded
full and on off stump, driven to mid on
floated up on the stumps again, drifting slightly with the wind. Punched to long on for one
the bowler keeps giving it air, hoping for the wind to do something. De Kock plays this ball behind square into the off side, and he hits a gap, so there's a single
full and on the stumps again, Amla eases it down to long off
another floater, this one straightens on about leg stump. De Kock hits it to mid on
Mathews starts off on the pads, Amla turns this behind square on the leg side
length, just wobbles away a bit, but it's nothing de Kock can't handle. He works this square on the legside for a single as well
full and wide, hugging the tram lines. Amla leaves it alone
full and wide again, seaming away. Amla plays at it and gets a toe edge to short cover
length, closer into the body. Amla tries to play this through off but doesn't time it

lovely shot, but there's poor fielding there as well. Amla drives this one on the up past short cover, and mid off should really have done better than dive over it. Runs away fro another boundary. South Africa off to a pretty smart start
floated up, inside edge to short midwicket
tossed up on the stumps again, pushed to the off side
de Kock skips down the pitch and lifts this over the leg side, into the wind. Lasith Malinga runs around from deep square leg to cut it off
floated up again, another thick inside edge to short midwicket
shortish and wide, de Kock slinks back quickly and thwacks this past point, all along the ground for four
oh! how did that miss the stumps? Lovely flight and dip from Senanayake, pitches on middle, bounces, turns beats the bat and Sanga collects it over off stump
length on off stump, pushed straight to mid off
full but a little wide, Amla drives through the covers, but there's a sweeper on the fence
angles this one across the leftie and beats the outside edge as de Kock pushes out at a length ball
fullish on the pads, de Kock whips it, but short midwicket collects
full and wide, de Kock gets low and smokes this through cover. There's a boundary almost every over and de Kock looks very good here
fullish and on off stump, de Kock pushes it straight of mid off and scampers through for one
length on off stump, cut to extra cover
tossed up again, pushed to short cover
comes down the track again, and launches this tossed up delivery over midwicket, against the wind. But there's enough opens space in the outfield for that to reach the fence
full, turning slightly away. Defended to short cover
shuffles down the pitch and pushes a full one to short cover, where the fielder collects and fires it back at the stumps, but manages only to hit a retreating de Kock on the buttocks
length on the stumps, defended into the off side
full and wide, Amla gets low and plays a smart shot wide of third man as he opens the face. Enough space to get two
full on off, Amla not looking to play massive strokes here. Just pushes it wide of mid on and gets a single.
length ball, angled across, De Kock stretches forward and defends.
angled across again, de Kock tries to get that square on the off side, but misses
length, angled across, de Kock connects with that open-faced glide this time and hits to third man
slower one, length on the stumps. Defended on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, defended

that's a smart shot by de Kock and he's really starting to flow here. He shuffles down the pitch again and hits with the turn, over the covers this time. He didn't seem to hit it very hard, but he gets it high enough for the wind to take hold and carry it way over the ropes

dropped at extra cover by Priyanjan. de Kock opens up and tries to get this over the covers again, but is beaten slightly by the turn. It's not an easy catch for Priyanjan, who has to dive hard to his left, but he just palms that above his head and the batsmen take three. Should have been caught.
fullish on the stumps, Amla hits this down the ground for a couple
length ball, turning in, Batsman gets back in his crease and turns it square
tossed up on the stumps, eased to long on
tossed up on off, de Kock leans forward and drives to mid off
tossed up again, pushed away defensively
tossed up on middle, de Kock leans forward and drives to long on
carrom ball I think, full and on off stump. Not a lot of turn yet. Pushed down to long off
flat, length ball on middle stump. Pushed defensively by de Kock
de Kock's got absolutely no worries about this pitch. It's dry, but there's no turn yet. He skips down, makes room and drills that square of mid on for a boundary. South Africa are flying here.
length outside off stump, Amla leans forward and pushes to the covers
Amla skips down, but doesn't quite get to the pitch. Pushes it back to the bowler
full and drifting, Amla hits it to short cover again
flighted beautifully in the stumps, Amla turns it to leg but finds short midwicket
slightly wider this time, but Amla can only find the short fielder on the offside again. Lovely start from Herath.
full on the stumps, this is eased down to long on for a single
floated up on off stump, driven to long off for a single
length ball, slow through the air but not a lot of turn. De Kock gets back in his crease and flicks this square on the legside, into a gap
floated wide of off stump, Amla leans into a drive but can't beat short cover
length on the stumps, Amla shuffles back and turns it to midwicket, where there is a gap
length on off stump, still barely any turn. De Kock just pushes defensively
nothing defensive about this. He's down the track again, and lifting it through that cover region that has been productive for him in the last few overs. Beats the field, gets another four
Amla tried to launch this down the ground, but doesn't get to the pitch of the ball, and decides to abort the stroke, chipping it in the air, but short of mid on
tossed up, straightening on off stump, turned into the legside, but it's fielded
full and on off, drilled down to long on
full and wide outside off, Amla drives this down to deep cover for one
tossed up, but not straightening, de Kock just lets it hit his pad. That's going way down the leg side
shuffles forward again, but once more, Herath makes it dip and the batsman can't get to the pitch. A thick inside edge squirts away toward midwicket
speared in on off stump, driven back to the bowler
toss up on the stumps, eased down the ground for a single
length ball, straightening on off stump. Punched to cover
he skips down, gets the ball as it pitches and drives it to long on
tossed up again, Amla plays a booming drive, but it takes the inside edge and goes wide enough of mid on for there to be a single
length, straightening on off. Pushed into the offside infield.
floated right up, and drifting into Amla, who defends
floated up again, a little wider, Amla leans forward and plays that silken off drive wide enough of long off for a couple
ooh. Fired flatter and faster from Herath to beat Amla's stroke and hit him on the pad. THere's a half-hearted appeal, but that's going down leg
fullish, Amla drives and a misfield at mid on allows a single
tossed up on the stumps, de Kock pushes back to the bowler. Late swing there.
full on the stumps, pushed to long on for one
tad short from Dilshan, de Kock rocks back and slams this past deep square leg, bissecting the field there nicely
full on the legs, de Kock works it square of the wicket for a single.
flatter and on the pads, Amla turns it to midwicket, who misfields and allows a single
flat on the stumps again, pushed away to the vacant offside for a single
full on the stumps, driven to long on
flat and fast outside off stump, chopped to extra cover
length ball just outside off stump, punched to the ring on the off side
a little fuller, outside off again. Amla moves across and defends
length on off again, Amla punches at it, searching for that offside gap. But he can't find it for now.
yorker on off stump. Malinga is bowling quite slow here. Amla digs it out back to the bowler
he couldn't find the gap, so he decides to go over the top. Malinga overpitches outside off, Amla gets beneath this and lifts this high over mid on for a two-bounce four
wide and full, Amla leans forward and cracks into this one, but again he finds the cover fielder
full and wide of the stumps, de Kock drives this wide of mid on for a single
short, on about off stump. Amla pulls this smartly down to deep midwicket. That was around throat high, but Mathews doesn't have the pace to trouble him
short of a length on off stump, and I think that passes just above the wickets as de Kock aims an expansive pull shot
length ball angled across, pushed away defensively into the off side
slightly fuller on off stump. De Kock just prods at this as well, but cover is too deep to prevent the single
length outside off stump, glides this away with an open face to third man
full on the stumps, whipped away to deep midwicket for a single
bouncer, head high, but there's really not much pace in this pitch and de Kock gets over the top of it, rolls his wrists and sends it down to fine leg
lovely inswinging yorker, dug out into the leg side by Amla
inswinging yorker again, but not quite in the blockhole. Amla jams it out back to the bowler

yorker again, but this is straying into the pads and it's easy pickings if you're seeing the ball like a blimp, which Amla is. That beats the man at the fine leg fence who does a poor job trying to get to it anyway
Malinga going full again, perhaps looking for some reveres. Amla drives at it, gets a thick inside edge and squirts it behind square on the leg side
length on the pads, turned behind square on the legside, but square leg cleans up
full and wide, Amla launches into a cover drive, but Senanayake does well at short cover to get a hand on it. Just one there
slightly wide length ball, de Kock stands tall and chops this in front of square on the off side. Deep cover has to run around so there' two for the taking
length ball, tighter into the stumps this time. De Kock chops it into the ground
short, wide, but he only manages to slice it, so it runs fine of where he wanted to hit it, where third man skips around to collect
length on off stump, Amla bangs this into the ground towards mid on, but the ball is traveling slowly enough to the fielder that the batsmen can cross
starts from wide out, tosses it up and Amla is content to drive it down the ground
flat but full on the stumps, swinging with the wind. De Kock eases it to long on as well

oh dear! Amla's not happy with himself here. He's out, just as he looked certain to make his third 50-plus score of the series. He was down the track, but Herath - that wily operator - beat him in the air for what seems like the 91st time today. Amla doesn't get to the pitch, and the shot that he tried to hit over the covers ends up going down long off's throat. Why do Sri Lanka refuse to play Herath regularly in ODIs? I'll never know.
flat again, on the stumps. De Kock eases it to long on again.
tossed up from wide of the stumps, Kallis plays a booming drive and gets a thick inside edge to square leg to get off the mark straight away
flat and full to de Kock again, who turns this into the legside infield, where there is a gap around midwicket
fullish on the stumps, turned to the midwicket fielder
straightening length ball on leg stump, clipped to square leg
de Kock shuffles down the track and hits this fullish ball down to long on
fullish delivery on off stump. Kallis defends
a full, floated two-finger googly. Kallis gets forward and prods it into the offside
floated up, but that's down the leg side
slow through the air again, this pitches on a length. Kallis is reading the direction of the turn pretty well so far. This one spins away from him a tad and he defends

Sanga's missed a stumping. Herath is surprisingly restrained. That ball swung away from de Kock with the swing, and the batsman is well out of his crease, but the keeper can't collect. Another missed chance
full on the stumps, turned away toward midwicket for a single
full on off stump, Kallis drives down to long off
full on the stumps again, de Kock drags this to the legside, but it's straight to midwicket
Herath's trying to get it swing away outside off again, but de Kock manages to squeeze it to point
full outside the off stump, chopped down square into the off side, Kallis doesn't want the single
floated on to the pads, Kallis tucks it away square on the legside for a sinlge

that's a nice shot. This is straightening outside the off side, but de Kock gets the reverse paddle out and uses the pace to deflect it towards fine leg. Mahela gives chase and cuts it off just inside the rope
tossed up on the stumps, Kallis leans forward and drives to cover
slower through the air, but not much turn, so Kallis punches this past extra cover for a single
shimmies down the pitch and punches it to long on
floated up on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
floated up on the pads, and the batsman turns this away square on the legside
slow through the air, length ball, straightening on the leg stump. De Kock tries to push it to off, but squeezes it into a legside gap off the inside edge

gone! That's out, surely. Rangana Herath slides this one with the arm, and hits Kallis low on the front pad around off stump. He did get bat on it as well, but it was after the ball hit pad. Kallis has asked for a review, but it's not looking good. It looks like the tracking software is not working, perhaps because of the wind at the venue. Anyway, despite the lack of a proper review, the umpire upholds his decision. There wasn't much doubt about that one anyway. Beautiful bowling by Herath. Kallis' woes continue.
wide of the stumps, pitched full and wide as well. AB just pushes this away to the off side
full and wide again. trying to tempt the batsman into a big drive. But he pushes unambitiously down the ground instead
this one is tighter into the stumps and straightening. Pushed defensively to leg.
full on the stumps, driven down the ground for a single
flat and fast wide of off stump, pushed into a gap at cover
de Villiers plays a reverse-sweep to a very very wide ball. Just manages to get a toe-end on it, but it's into a gap square on the off side
tossed up on off stump, poked into that cover gap again
length on the pads, not much turn. De Villiers flicks this square on the legside, and the batsmen run hard to get a couple as the legside sweeper sprints around
length outside off stump, fired in a little flat. AB drives this through the covers to the offside sweeper
huge swing for Herath with the wind. This loops into AB, who wisely defends
sent in a little flatter, and AB can reach out and stroke it through the covers for a single
quick and flat, de Kock knew little about that. It's gone off the inside edge past the stumps,  and they can get one
fullish, tossed up on off stump. AB makes room and squeezes it away past point for a couple
makes a lot of room again, and Herath chooses not to follow the batsman. Fires it in flat at the stumps, but AB strokes it through the covers again
ooh! Beats the batsman's outside edge, and Sanga appeals for the stumping, having taken off the bails. De Kock doesn't take his foot off the ground though, so he's well safe.
tossed up on off stump, drilled to long on
tossed up and drifting in to middle stump. De Kock knocks it to short midwicket
tossed up on the stumps again, whipped straight to short midwicket again
full, slightly wide, De Kock chops it wide of short third man
length ball, fired flat on the pads. De Villiers can't connect and Dilshan raises a half-hearted appeal
on the legs again, but AB doesn't miss out twice. Strokes this casually down to deep midwicket to keep the strike
tossed up from wide of the stumps again, looking for that drift. AB makes room again and hits through cover
flat and fast on off stump, de Kock opens the face and gets it to short third man
down the track, but Herath fires it in flatter. AB pushes it to long on
tossed up on off stump, de Kock shimmies across and works to toward midwicket
gives this a lot of air, and that moves into AB with the wind. He makes room again, but can't beat short cover
another flighted one. This is a lovely little battle between these two. AB makes room, but again can't beat the offside ring
flat on the off stump, de Kock pushes at it defensively
fired in flat and fast, de Kock opens the face to get it wide of short third man again. Dilshan appeals, but it's all bat
full on off stump, AB gets that favoured cover drive out again
full on the stumps,  driven to long on
length on the pads, and that's whammed to deep midwicket for a single
flat on off stump, de Kock launches into a booming drive, but doesn't collect all that well. Gets the single through cover though
flat on the pads, pushed away to the gap at midwicket

AB must have heard me. That's a misdirected googly from Mendis, and AB picks it perfectly. Gets low and sweeps violently behind square leg for a boundary. Takes a deflection off the diving fielder I think
this is even better. Another legside ball and AB launches that over deep square leg with the wind. Another slog sweep. Sanga tells Mendis not to bowl there.
down the track, but Mendis yorks him. AB pushes it back to the bowler
short outside off now, and AB chops it past point for a single
flat around off stump, de Kock pushes to a fielder on the offside
flighted outside off stump, AB opens the face late on that one and gets it wide of short third man for a single
slower through the air, pitching on off, driven back to Dilshan
he's into the 90s with a textbook back-cut off a short, wide ball. de Kock slides back and bissects point and backward point nicely
slinks down the track and drills a full delivery to long on
full on the pads, tucked away behind square for a single
shortish again, a little wide. Cuts that to point and scampers, but would have been in trouble at the non-striker's end if there had been a direct hit
full on the stumps, driven to long off
tossed up again, this is drilled to long on
rocks back to a slightly short ball and punches this to the cover sweeper
full and straightening on the stumps, pushed to short midwicket
flighted and straightening on leg stump, driven to long on
that's the googly, and it takes an outside edge and runs away very fine. Priyanjan gives chase and keeps it to three
fired into off stump, de Kock punches this through cover to move to 99
fired flat again, and AB reverse-paddles that to get QdK on strike again
another flat ball, on leg stump this time. Batsman pushes this to short midwicket

and there it is. That's another flat one, he pushes it to cover and scampers through. That's his fourth hundred in six ODI innings. Superb knock from the young man. He's set SA up for a very big score here.

ohh, that was almost a missed chance. AB drives this past Dilshan at about thigh-height, but it's just too far to the right of the bowler. Dilshan is often exceptional off his own bowling, but that was hit very hard
this is a more run-of-the-mill single down the ground
ooh, was that reverse? Or just the wind. Anyway, he fires this way down legside, and takes AB's toe edge, before sliding down fine for four. There was a bit of movement in the air
this is on target. Inswinging yorker, dug out straight of midwicket for a single
length on the pads, QdK turns it square on the legside for a single
full and swinging in again, but this is wide of off stump. AB drives to mid off

another inswinging yorker, but AB comes down the crease, turns it into a full toss and absolutely murders this through midwicket for four. Some shot that. AB is looking good for a big innings as well.
length on the legs this time, AB works that to the wide open spaces on the leg side
tossed up, turning in slightly. AB misses with the reverse-paddle, but it dribbles away off the pad and they can take a single
not much turn for Senanayake. This is a length ball angled into the pads. It hits de Kock, but it's heading way down leg
another length ball on the stumps, pushed away to off

that's another length ball, but QdK is out with murderous intent for that one. He rocks back and heaves it hard over midwicket for a 77 metre six. Sanga tells the bowler to try turn it a bit more, with more than just a hint of frustration. SA completely bossing this innings
tossed up, driven to long on
AB skips down the track and knocks this flighted ball down to long on
full delivery, eased to long on
slower ball on middle stump, QdK pushes this down the ground for a single
slower offcutter again, and he beats AB this time. He drives at that one and it turns off the surface to beat his bat and narrowly avoid the stumps as well
thats fifty for AB. Gee he's batting well. Doesn't he always. Shimmies down the pitch, gets Malinga on the half-volley and crashes this over midwicket, with the wind, for four

this is just very high quality batting. Mathews had moved a man onto the on side after the last shot, but Malinga fires this one full and wide of off. AB gets low and smears this through cover, all along the ground for four
another off cutter, AB relents with the big shots and just hits this to midwicket. Steve Davis can't hold onto his hat. Wellington eat your heart out.
length on the stumps, straightening a tad. QdK gets on the front pad and pushes it to midwicket
another big shot with the wind, QdK gets low and slog sweeps that over deep square leg for six. Nice, well-thought out, controlled shot
another sweep, but a less ambitious one. Gets it to deep square leg for a single
the SL bowlers are struggling with their lines in the wind. This is on the pads, but this is just worked to deep midwicket
aims a huge swipe over the legside again, but Senanayake pitches this wide of off stump and turns it away. De Kock misses
this is turning away from around off stump. Takes a thick outside edge and goes fine of short third man for a single
QdK tries a reverse sweep to a full Herath ball, but only gets a glove off it
conventional sweep off a full ball and this is far enough in front of deep square leg to get a couple
down the track and QdK lifts this over wide mid on again, hitting with the wind. Heas barely touch this but it just keeps going with the wind. Lands just inside the rope.
full on the stumps, eased to long on for one
drifts it into the pads, De Villiers turns it behind square but finds square leg
that is hit flat and hard and the wind does the rest. I'm not sure about this angle. Herath pitches it on middle stump and AB gets under it to slam it over deep square leg
length ball straightening into de Kock. Hits him on the pads and SL appeal, but it's pitched outside leg I think
full on off stump, de Kock slides down the pitch and slams it past mid off for four
length on the stumps, defended to the off side

doesn't matter. He's gone anyway. QdK attempts the same shot he played earlier in the over. It's a fullish ball, but Senanayake beats him in the flight and though the batsman gets a good chunk of the ball, he's hitting against the breeze. He hits that into the arms of Mendis at long off. End of a fine innings from a very promising player.
drifts it into the pad, pushed away to the legside
down the track to a flighted delivery, clipped through square leg for a couple
flat outside off stump, punched through cover for a single
flat outside off stump again, JP gets back and chops it between the square fielders with the wind, Two men give chase and cut it off
AB is maneuvring this ball superbly. This is pitched way ouside off, but AB reaches out and drags it all the way to leg with another big sweep. Travels quickly to the square leg fence
full outside off again, but this is hit to sweeper cover
tighter into the stumps from Herath, Duminy pushes back to the bowler
flighted on the stumps, JP strides forward and defends
length on off stump, turning in. AB swats it to midwicket
short ball, AB gets on his knees to sweep when he perhaps could have stayed on his feet. Still hits it hard, but can't beat square leg
fuller from SS, that's worked to long on
length ball, wide of off. JP just chops it down
wide length ball again, JP again cuts it but it's straight to square leg - sort of. The ball is swirling around in the wind, even when it's just traveling on the ground
this is angled into the pads and JP whips it to deep midwicket
slower ball on the pads, JP tucks it away behind square for a single
full and wide of off stump. AB drives at that, bit doesn't judge the pace and is too early on the shot. Mistimes it back to the bowler
AB moves way across to the off side, and Malinga fires it way out there as well. This pitches almost off the cut strip, but it's not wide because the ball passed under the bat
wide yorker again, keeping the ball well away from the side of the ground AB wants to hit to. He gets it as far as mid off
wide yorker once more, AB drags it to long on for a single

this is a terrible ball in any other game, a full delivery outside leg stump. But in the windswept parallel universe of Hambantota, it is a decent ball, and JP can only clip that to short fine leg. Crazy tactics. Crazy conditions. Love it.
floated up outside off, JP drags it with the sweep to deep midwicket
this is fired into the stumps from wide of the crease, AB makes room and slaps this to deep cover, where a fielding error allows a second
fired in on the stumps again, and AB makes room again to hit it through cover. Only he has smoked this one. Sweeper cover can only watch it whizz by in front of him
Jeez, what a shot. Another full ball on the stumps, AB gets low and reverse sweeps this with aplomb sending it sailing over square leg to the vacant outfield for four. the wind carries it far
SS trying to bowl a leg stump line, but he's too far legside here
tossed up on off, drilled to long on for the single
fired in flat and fast outside off, JP pokes that to cover
full outside off stump, this was supposed to be a yorker, but becomes a friendly full toss outside off. AB just golf-swings through that one and sends it sailing over long on. 87 metres on that six
wide yorker, pitches the ball this time and AB just knocks that into an offside gap
slower ball on the pads, JP pushes that to the legside. Just looking for the single here, because AB is batting up a dream
huh. Maybe not. Malinga sends another slower ball down, but you've got to say, that is in the slot for JP. He reaches out and wallops that one over wide long on for an 80 metre six
full and on the stumps, worked to midwicket
wide yorker again, slammed to long on for a single
gets caught trying to bowl too legside here  (away from the wind). AB just shuffles towards off, gets to his knees and shovels that over short fine leg for four. SHot.
the other side of the pitch now. This is an exhibition from AB. This is a bouncer over the stumps. AB makes room and swats that between cover and mid off somehow, all the way for four. 300 up.
Sri Lanka are losing their way. That's a massive legside wide. Sanga had no chance, really. Five wides. The helmet behind the keeper is being blown around as well, so it gets chucked off the field.

length ball outside off stump, AB drills it wide of mid off to get the single that takes him to triple figures. Take a bow AB. That's some innings. Off 66 balls too. He's given the opposition a mountain to climb in a high-pressure match.
JP moves toward the offside, but Mathews overcompensates and fires it well wide of the batsman as well
more sloppiness in the field. JP drags a length ball outside off toward midwicket, who fumbles it and allows an easy single
full and wide, dragged to square leg
fired in at the legs, it might have been called wide had AB not splayed his legs and the ball passed between them. Wasn't far from the stumps though.
slower full toss, swinging wide of the stumps. JP reaches out and squirts it straight to point. Wind got hold of that one I think,
full and wide again, JP throws his bat at it and times it beautifully. Cover sweeper runs around but can't do a thing about it.
JP jumps down the leg side to open off side up, but Malinga follows him with a yorker. No run.

full on the pads, and JP doesn't miss out this time. Malinga is being deconstructed. JP stays in his usual stance, and slams that full toss off his toes through midwicket. Legside sweeper ain't getting there.
slower ball, shorter and at the body. Tucked away to fine leg.
wide length ball, AB drags that in the air to long on. Doesn't hit it perfectly, so it's just a single.
length on off stump, and AB goes back easy as you like and just wallops that over long off for six. Incredible that he got that much power into the shot. What a start to the over. 350 may be on here,
fuller and on the stumps, swept away to deep midwicket
length on the stumps, straightening slightly. Clobbered away aerially towards long on, but it bounces well short

he's gone. Finally, but the damage has been done. AB gets a googly and he tries to slam that over wide long on, but ends up mishitting it towards the cover sweeper. Priyanjan has had a poor day in the field, but he does well to keep his eyes on this one, as the wind carries it. A brilliant innings comes to an end.

erm, what was that? A friendly full toss, and JP was way too early into the shot. This is chipped back at Mendis who swallows it with ease. Maybe the wind got a hold of this one and changed the direction. Either way, it's two in two for Sri Lanka.
carrom ball on leg stump, straightening. McLaren turns it to short fine leg, no run.
slower short ball, ably handled by Miller, Pulls this down to deep square leg for a couple.
slower short ball again, but this is pulled straight at deep square leg, so it's just a single.
another slower short ball, swatted toward deep midwicket, and the pair scamper a couple. The throw hits the batsman.
slower bouncer, McLaren attempts a fairly ambitious reverse-pull. Hits him on the helmet instead and they take a leg bye
Another slower ball and Sanga can't collect the ball on the half-volley, Hasn't had a great day behind the stumps, though that was a tough one. Runs away for four byes.
slower short ball again, pulled away to the legside to square leg for a single.

inn2.comm: full outside off stump, Kusal plays at it half-heartedly but gets nowhere near
no mistake there from Kusal. Steyn strays on to the pads, and pitches short as well. Kusal moves across and swivel-pulls that along the ground behind square for four
full outside off stump, drives straight to cover
full outside off again. Steyn is trying to stay on the right side of the wind. Kusal crunches it to cover.
length ball from around the wicket, Kusal pushes this away to the off side
Steyn goes wide of the crease from around the wicket and fires this short one down the leg side
angled in at Kusal, into the body. The batsman defends the short of the length ball.
into the ribcage around off stump first up. Dilshan deadbats it down to the pitch
length outside off stump, Dilshan gets on the front foot and pushes it wide enough of mid off to skip through to the other end
length ball, angled across. Kusal defends. Not looking too hurried here.
full ball angled across to outside off stump. Kusal pushes to the covers, where it should have been fielded. A fumble allows a quick single.
big booming drive, but Morkel's bounce and pace mean Dilshan doesn't really get close to it. It's a wide, length ball
gets hold of that one though. Short again from Morkel, about stomach-high. Dilshan gets the front foot pull out and sends it between cover and extra. That goes quickly with the wind
bowls from wide out and pitches well outside off stump. Kusal drives at the length ball and misses
length on the pads, Kusal turns it behind square using the pace and gets two as fine leg runs around.
fuller, but on the pads again. Clipped away square this time. Fine leg sprints around to clean up once more
bouncer outside off stump, Kusal sways away
angled at the body, Kusal has a swing, Steyn appeals, but the umpire calls it a wide. 146kph. Umpire gets it right.
thwack! Steyn is fast, but so is Kusal's bat speed, Short of a length on the stumps, Kusal gets his front foot across and slams this in front of deep square leg for four

big appeal here. Steyn's angle might work against him though. Hits Kusal on the front pad in front of about middle, but the ball is speared in from wide out, so AB gets together with his troops and decides against the review. Meanwhile, the batsmen run through
short of a length on off, Kusal just bunts it towards the short cover
ho! What a shot. Backs away, Morkel fires it in at the stumps and Kusal slams hit high and hard over cover for six. The wind takes it miles. They will need plenty more of that. Smart batting.
length on the pads, Kusal pushes this into the leg side.
full on the stumps, Kusal pushes it away to a gap in the off side infield

ok so picture this. Overpitched from Morkel, driven hard past Morkel on the off side. Lovely shot, but even all along the ground the wind gets hold of the ball and blows it toward the leg side. By the time it crosses the rope it's around where long on would stand.
length on the stumps, pushed to mid on for a single
Steyn fires this way down the off side, and the wind takes it away from QdK. Third man has to run in and clean that up.
that's way down the leg side
full on the pads. Kusal pushes it back to Steyn.
full on the stumps again, defended
lovely shot again, gets his front foot across and slams a full  Steyn ball through midwicket for four, Jayasuriya style.
short of a length on the stumps, Kusal backs away and smokes it between point and cover for four. Another fine stroke.
down leg side again from Steyn, Kusal turns it around the corner for a well-run two

murder. That's in the slot at 144kph, and Kusal latches on to it off a length on off stump, and short arm jabs it with the wind, over the midwicket fence. He's flying away here. He always does. Can he keep it going?
friendly ball to start. It's fired down the leg side and Dilshan just helps it past the keeper and to the fine leg fence. Too good to miss out there.
length ball on off stump, Dilshan drives it past the bowler on the up and mid off slides across to stop it

a slower ball does the trick for Kusal. So often Kusal gets off to a flyer and gives it away. He's done a decent job here though. This is full outside off stump, Kusal tries to bang that over mid off, but he mistimes it and offers a simple catch to the man there instead. AB, the fielder, holds up a clenched fist.
short of a length outside off stump, Sanga punches that through cover and point and the man on the fence has to run around and field
length ball on the pads, he works that into the on side, but straight at midwicket
wide length ball, Sanga tried to cut that but the ball passed beneath his bat.
full and on the stumps, Dilshan whips that to mid on, where a misfield allows an easy single
length outside off stump, he just pushes that into the infield and scampers through before the fielder grabs the ball
bouncer at the throat, but Dilshan is in too good a nick to let that rattle him. He gets on top of the ball and swivel-hooks it behind square for a boundary. That was against the wind as well.
length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
length on off again, Dilshan gets that to mid on
short of a length on the stumps, Dilshan wants to turn it to leg, but can only get it to midwicket
yorker outside off stump, slower ball I think. Sanga just jams it out
comes down the pitch and flays that straight of a very wide mid off for four. It was length and wide from Parnell, but Sanga advances to make it almost a half volley
full on the pads, this is just worked to a legside gap and they take one
length ball, straightening on about off stump. Dilshan pushes it square, but it's straight to point
wide way down the leg side
fuller outside off, driven neatly to sweeper cover for a couple
full on the stumps, Dilshan drives this slightly wide of mid on and hares to the other end
full on the stumps, Dilshan drives it to mid on and scampers through again. The fielder hits the stumps at the non-striker's end, but Dilshan is home by a few inches.
on the pads, helped along its way by Sanga. Not the place to bowl at all. Easy pickings down to the fine leg fence. Sri Lanka race on.
short ball, wide down the leg side.
length outside off, Sanga bunts this and wants a run, but Dilshan says no
great shot. This is into Sanga's hips. He just slaps it over square leg, and it lands inches inside the boundary
angled across him to off stump, Sanga shuffles across and clips it to square leg for a single
length ball wide of the stumps, Dilshan throws his bat at it and sends the ball square, but point is on to it quickly
down the to a length ball, turning it into a half volley. He strikes it beautifully over midwicket, but it's right into the wind, so it stops way short of the boundary.
full outside off, Parnell gets away with that. Sanga leans into a cracking cover drive, and picks out the man at cover

Sanga's down the track, hitting into the wind again. Bowler's just can't win here. Parnell sees him coming and pitches it short, but Sanga plays an advancing pull and gets it in front of square for four

now that's just good batting. That's length outside off stump and Sanga keeps targeting that on side, slamming it over midwicket for four. Didin't get a lot of elevation there, so it didn't get caught in the wind.
length outside off, Sanga opens the face and sends it to point. Dilshan doesn't want the run.

geez that's class. He's down the track turning a length ball into a half volley again. This one is quite wide of off stump, so he drills it through mid off for a boundary. That's one hell of a Powerplay for Sri Lanka. Long, long way to go though,
short ball outside off, chopped away to the cover sweeper. That's 100 for the hosts.
length on the pads, clipped to deep square leg for a single
length outside off stump, Dilshan throws his bat at it and misses
length on off stump, Dilshan just pushes it straight back and the bowler fields it
full ball, wide of off stump, Dilshan throws his hands again and connects beautifully this time. Beats extra cover and the offside sweeper.
length on off stump, Dilshan pushes it to cover and sprints through
starts with a massive googly. Serious turn there. So much that it drifts and turns way down leg

mayhem! SA get the breakthrough via a run out where both batsmen end up at the same end. Dilshan is not happy with Sanga. He whips it straight to shortish-midwicket and takes off, Sanga moves towards him initially, but then turns back. Not sure who made which call. Sanga gets back to the non-striker's crease first and Dilshan has to walk off. QdK takes the bails off easy.
pitched on leg, straightening. Mahela just clips it toward deep square leg.
drifted wide from Tahir, he's looking good. Sanga pokes at it and gets an outside edge to the short third man
drifts it toward off again and Sanga strokes it straight to cover
another floated one, drifting away. Sanga gets it to long off now.
full outside off stump, straightening. Defended
full and wide, Sanga square drives it between cover and backward point, it's cut off centimetres inside the fence by Tahir
full outside off, driven straight to mid on
length outside off stump, defended into the off side
full and straight, driven firmly but straight to a short-ish mid off
length ball wide of off stump, Mahela opens the face late on that and gets it to third man

gone!  Stangled down the leg side. Sanga goes now and that's a huge blow for this chase. That was an awful ball, waist height about six inches outside leg. Sanga tries to help it on its way, but gets an under edge. Two wickets in two overs now. McLaren had a sliver of his boot behind the white line, so it's not a no-ball, thought the umpires check it.
floated up on middle stump, straightening. defended

gone! Sri Lanka are falling apart here. Mahela's gone now, playing a top-edged sweep that carried all the way to the man at fine leg, thanks to some help from the wind. He didn't want to sweep it that hard, but any shot to that side of the ground is going to carry further. Huge pressure on this inexperienced middle order now. They need a big stand. Imran Tahir is ecstatic. But isn't he always?
drifting in and turning into him. Googly. Mathews turns it square on the leg side to get off the mark
drifted wide, spinning away from Thiri. Googly again. Left alone
another googly, but a quick one. Defended.
Drifted wide again. Thirinamme hits it to cover
full on off stump, turned to the vacant leg side for a single.
length ball angled across him, leaves it alone
length angled across him as well, punched to cover
length outside off stump again, Thiri defends it to the off side
short ball on off stump, Thiri pulls the legside sweeper to get off the mark
Maclaren comes in from wide of the crease and bowls full. Mathews drives but misses as the ball seams away a tad
drifting across him, Thiri punches it to the cover sweeper
drifiting to leg, then straightening on the stumps. Mathews blocks it to the leg side
flighted nicely, straightening on off. Defended by Mathews
oooh! That's close. That's pitching on middle and straightening slightly, but it's probably going down leg. Appeal is raucouls, but the umpire turns it down immediately
pitches on middle and straightens again, Mathews pushes to off
Tahir causing problems here. Straightens on middle again, Mathews manages to get a thick edge on it as he plays back in the crease to that.
full on the stumps, eased to long on
pitches outside leg, straightens, and QdK misses it. Runs down to the boundary for five wides
straightening on leg stump again, Mathews pushes into the leg side.
oh boy, even Duminy looks threatening. He pitches outside off and turns it back sharply, both Mathews and QdK miss it, and that's two more byes
skips down the pitch and eases this to long on
floated wide, Thirimanne just pushes it to cover
straightening on the pads, THirimanne pushes this straight of short midwicket, so there's a run for the taking
short and wide, it's the googly so it keeps going away from him. Thiri reaches out and slaps it behind square for a couple
drifts it wide of the leftie again. Thiri reaches out and an inside edge to long on gets him a single
straightens on the stumps, eased to long on
drifted wide, straightening. Thiri tries to cut it, but chops it down off the under edge
wide again, Thirimanne strokes it into a gap at cover this time
straightening, tossed up. Mathews defends
full and outside off stump, thumped to long off
wow, that took off off the surface. Pitched on middle and spun miles down the leg side
this is floated on on off stump, hit down to long on
floated up on off stump, pushed defensively in to the off side.
length ball on the pads, worked into a legside gap
full on the stumps, defended to leg
floated up on the stumps, defended again
googly again, drifting away. Thiri chops it down to deep point
straightening outside off, floated in. Mathews pushes to point.
full on the stumps, driven to mid on. No run.
Straightening on off stump, Mathews defends
floated in on off stump again, another defensive prod
googly in at middle stump, Mathews is back whipping this to midwicket, where it's smartly fielded by Amla
that's floated wide and full, Thiri leans forward to drive it through the covers and they take two. Good running.
fired in full, Thirimanne digs it out
pitching on off and spinning away slightly, hits the outside half of the bat but it lands safely

Thirimanne tried to dab this wide one, de Kock appealed for caught behind and won, Thirimanne reviewed immediately, there is no Hot Spot and Snicko, the third umpire has just sound to go on, and there is none at all as the ball passes bat, no deviation, not even a change in the seam position, Thirimanne survives
pushes forward at one leaving him on the angle and is beaten
tossed up full around leg, pushed to midwicket
he pushes forward to defend a full ball just outside off, it takes a thick inside edge behind square leg
full and well outside off, skips down the track and drives that towards long-off for a single
skips out, and drives past short extra cover to long off
full one driven to covers
short and wide, cut away behind point
floated in on the stumps, defended
down the track, knocked to long off
dragged Mathews forward with a teasing length, then beat the bat. Qdk fumbles, but don't think that was a chance
a low full toss on middle and off, he works it to midwicket
full on off stump, Thiri drives him through cover for a single
length ball on off stump, defended solidly
length outside off, Mathews drives at that but doesn't time it. Straight to cover
short of a length on off stump, Mathews tries to shovel this away on the leg side, but it takes the top of his thigh pad and loops away towards third man. There's time for a couple of leg byes.
full and outside off stump, Mathews gets in nicely behind it
full on the stumps, Mathews defends it back to the bowler
floated up on middle, Thiri skips down and hits it right back to JP

what a ball! He's been turning a few quite sharply all innings, but this time he gets a wicket for it. He's coming in from wide of the crease, flighting it in to pitch at around off stump. The ball spins sharply, beats Thiri's blade, which is miles away, and crashes into off. Sri Lanka's woes continue. Huge job ahead.
full, floated up outside off stump, Ashan drives to cover
floated up again, straightening on the stumps, defended
floated wide, Priyanjan gets a big stride in and defends once more
that's floated a little too wide and full, and Priyanjan doesn't like blocking too many. He launches into that one, slapping it straight of cover, all along the ground for four
intent from Mathews. He runs down the pitch and crashes a length ball from Steyn at mid off. It's hit so hard, the fielder there can't take it cleanly. Batsmen run two off the misfield
length outside off, Mathews just pushes to off. No run.
short and at the body, swivel-pulled down to fine leg
short and at the body again, Priyanjan sways beneath it
full and on off stump, Priyanjan blocks it out
short ball again, but this is given a wide for height. Yep, that went over the head.
short and wide, Priyanjan plays a booming cut but collects only fresh air

floated up on the leg stump, Mathews goes for the sweep and it hits pad I think. Duminy goes up in appeal and SA choose to review this. It's probably hitting the stumps, but it may have pitched outside leg. Yes, it has. A couple of inches outside leg. Always struggling to get an lbw from around the wicket.
fired flat outside off stump, Mathews skips down and gets it past diving midwicket for a single
JP slides this across the batsman, who lunges at it and is beaten
pitches tighter into the stumps this time, and he just drives it down to long off
length ball, straightening on the stumps, defended
way down the leg side
tossed up on the stumps, knocked down to long on for a single
length outside off stump, Mathews defends that
boom, he's been looking for that boundary for a while. Skips down the track, turns length into half volley, and sends it back past the bowler for a bludgeoned boundary
full toss on the pads, just clips that to fine leg. Could have done more with that, maybe
length outside off, Priyanjan opens the face and sends it to point. He's looking for a single, but Mathews turns him back
length outside off again, Priyanjan gets across and tries to punch that through cover, but he misses completely
short ball outside off stump, Priyanjan bunts it square on the off side and they take a single
length outside off stump, Priyanjan prods at it and misses
persevering with this length outside off for Priyanjan. This time he opens the face and sends it to third man
down the track again, Mathews, frees his arms and smokes this through the covers for four. SL almost need a boundary an over from here on in.
short of a length, on the legs. Hits thigh pad and they scamper through.
that's short of a length and hugging the offside tram line. It's called wide. Maybe a little harsh
length outside off stump thick edge, but it's controlled. Slip fields that
length on off stump, defended watchfully
bouncer first up, Mathews rides it and drops it into the legside, then they scamper through. McLaren does the fielding on his follow through
full angled in to off stump, steered to third man
length outside off stump, Mathews just drives this back to the bowler
short ball, about nipple-high. Turned away with a swivel, along the ground to fine leg
length ball on off stump, Priyanjan is forward to defend
short of a length over off stump., Piyanjan gets on the back foot and punches it to a man in the offside infield
into the ribcage first up, Mathews swats this away to the legside
short ball again, but this is outside off. Priyanjan sways away
back of a length on off stump, Priyanjan bunts it into the offside and scampers through. The throw misses, but he would have been home I think.
short of a length outside off stump, Mathews drags this square on the leg side, where there is oodles of space
length speared into off stump, Priyanjan defends it
short ball angled into leg stump, It goes to the legside of Priyanjan, but the umpire doesn't think it's a wide
length on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
not too wide, but it's short enough for Priyanjan to cut. He gets it behind square but fine leg runs around to cut it off
length outside off stump, Priyanjan punches that very late, straight to cover
short on off stump, Priyanjan plays a big pull shot, doesn't quite hit it properly, but he gets it as far  as the legside sweeper
full on the pads, Mathews whips this to deep square leg
length ball outside off stump, steered to third man
long hop to start with, Priyanjan cuts it but not with enough conviction to beat the legside sweeper
full on off stump, pushed defensively to leg
floated up on off again, once more Mathews only just prods this to short midwicket
flatter and on the pads, turned around the corner to short fine leg
slightly short, and wide of off stump, Priyanjan cuts this square
flat, straightening on off stump, punched back to the bowler
that's full and about a foot outside leg, Priyanjan just helps it to the boundary. Easy.
much better. Short of a length outside off stump, Priyanjan tries to late cut that to the third man fence but misses
length ball angled across, Priyanjan reaches across to hit it but misses again
short of a length outside off stump again, dragged to the man at deep midwicket
length on the pads, Mathews clips that to deep midwicket
bouncer at the throat. Priyanjan gets on top of it and controls it down to Amla at fine leg. Couple there. Eight off the over.
floated up, straigthening outside off stump. Mathews slaps him to cover
floated up outside off, eased to long off
flat and turning away outside off, cut away to the offside sweeper
almost a long hop, Mathews tries to pull but doesn't get a hold of it. Almost lobs it to midwicket
short and wide, Mathews slaps it straight to point
shortish and wide again, Mathews hits it to point, but they scamper through
this is length on the legs and that's four. Another average ball to start the over, Mathews just had to clip it past square leg and he's away
slower ball down the leg side. Steyn's radar just a little off
length ball outside off stump, Mathews gets forward and defends
short and wide, Mathews smashes that behind square on the off side. This is turning into a decent over, but Sri Lanka are only making small dents
full and on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
Priyanjan comes down the track, but Steyn has pitched it short outside off stump, and Priyanjan can't connect with his swat
length outside off stump, he tries to open the face and glide it to third man, but misses
that's a length ball straightening, Duminy is coming around the wicket. Mathews plays a massive reverse sweep and misses. He is hit on the thigh pad and they appeal, but that's pitching outside leg
wide down the leg side and QdK can't collect cleanly
floated in on the stumps, Priyanjan gets low and slams that over short fine leg for four. Good shot
down the track, making the ball into a full toss, this is just hit past the bowler for one
floated up on off stump, Mathews reverse paddles that and gets something on it. Runs to the third man fence for four
flat and on the stumps, hit back to the bowler
floated in on the stumps, Mathews whips this to deep midwicket
takes the liberty of offering a full toss outside off to Mathews, who is gracious enough to find the man at extra cover
rolls his fingers across the shortish ball and Mathews nudges it into the leg side for a single
bit of width and Priyanjan lashes one to point. Duminy does well. Missed out on a boundary and he knows it
back of a length just outside off, all the fielders are on the edge of the circle. Mathews trots across to the other end
slower short ball, Priyanjan was set to whack it over square on the off side, but just sought to hit it a little too hard to connect
what happened there? McLaren gets carried away with the change of pace. Offcutter goes wild but thankfully the beamer was well wide of off stump. Apologises immediately
flicked off his knees to retain strike
straightening outside off, pushed to cover
floated in, spinning sharply into Mathews, he can't get it past Tahir
floated in again and straightening, Mathews clips it to midwicket for wond
short and wide, Priyanjan can't beat backward point with his cut
down the track to make that a full toss, hits down to long on
straightening on middle stump again, Mathews drives to long off
bouncer, Mathews isn't in total control of the hook, but he's not trying to hit it too hard. Single to fine leg
length outside off stump, Priyanjan drives hard, but cover fields it well. SA have saved a hell of a lot of runs in the field

gone! Priyanjan always looked uncomfortable against the slower bouncer. This one bounces less than he expected. He's trying to swat it away to the off side but it takes a thin edge through to the keeper. Mathews is now stuck with the tail and SL are still over 100 runs away.
full outside off stump, good looking drive first up, but he doesn't pierce the field
length outside off stump, Senanayake just gets forward and pushes it to point. Require rate well over 10 now.
lovely shot that. That's a bouncer about chest high, but it's just outside off. SS stands tall and plays that ramp shot through where slip would stand. Third man is too square to cut it off.
turning away wide of off stump, Matews opens the face and gets it as far as point
full on the stumps, eased to long on to complete his half centiury. Might need twice that amount to get SL close
lovely ball, drifted into off stump, pitches and turns away beating the bat and the stumps
doesn't read the googly, Tried to run it off the face to third man but almost inside edges it back onto the stumps. Passes between the keeper's legs and there's a single there
latches on to that one. Mathews is sick of letting Tahir dictate. He gets on one knee and slog sweeps him against the turn, over the square leg fence
pitched wide of off stump, turning away. Mathews cuts but can't beat point. How good has SA's fielding been?

Mathews almost hits that down long on's throat. He tried to smash that over the fence, but didn't quite middle it. Du Plessis comes off the rope and makes a good effort to catch it, but it just doesn't carry
slower short of a length ball, Senanayake tries to glide it to third man, but misses
full delivery outside off stump, SS plays a huge drive, gets an inside edge and squirts it to short fine leg

super catch, and that may be the game for the hosts! Again the bouncer gets rid of a batsman. Mathews doesn't control the hook shot, and the tallest man on the park is at short fine leg. Morkel sticks his giant paws up and the ball sticks to his left palm like it's a glue trap. South Africa on the brink of making ODI history here. AB plants a big kiss on Morkel's cheek. He knows what that wicket means, and he's not afraid to show it.
length outside off stump, Herath guides it to third man
yorker, dug out toward long on
fast leggie, SS tries to chop it, but misses
another quick leggie, SS is down the pitch and gets pad in the way
floated up and turning away sharply, the batsman doesn't even play at that
floated in on off stump, driven down to long off
Herath tries the reverse sweep first up, probably picked the googly, Doesn't connect though
floated up on off stump, defended by Herath
short and somewhat wide. SS gets nicely under it and hits it over backward point for four
another short ball, quicker this time and closer in to the stumps. The batsman tries to repeat the dose and misses
full on off stump, SS is too early into the shot, but he gets an inside edge and takes a single to the leg side
short and a little wide, Herath tries to heave it away to the leg side, but only gets a top edge. It goes high over the keeper, but QdK runs back to complete a pretty comfortable catch.

two in two for Morkel. That's a full toss that Senanayake tries to loft over the off side, but he's hitting into the wind and has played the shot too early in any case. Jacques Kallis gets under it at the edge of the circle and pouches it no problem. SA one wicket away from their first ODI series win in the country.
full toss on off stump, Mendis just defends it
wide of off stump, but he turns it back in just enough for it to be legal
floated up, straightening on middle, defended
Malinga is down the track trying to smash it over the bowler's head, but mistimes it horribly and sends up a lob. Duminy backtracks from the crease and gets under it. Makes no mistake.
